result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick G Klitzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 18 mo.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent & IID.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JPG. No alcohol in his residence.

Sobrietor for 4 mo after release from DCJ. Write letter of apology to victim & person who had to jump out of way (DSR) & give letters to PO agent.   Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick G Klitzman

and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
INfo filed copy given defn, reading waived, plea of NG entered, motions due 20 days, bail continued.
Waiver of Right to PH filed.  Defn advised of right to and waived PH.  Ct accepted waiver of pH.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant in court with Attorney Michael J Short.  Emily Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with James G
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any alcohol in his/her system.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 12

Defendant in court with Attorney Michael J Short.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
